title.value: Offline wikis and OER (Open Educational Ressources)

value.ol:
Offline wikis and OER – Open Educational Ressources
All below mentioned documents can be downloaded from http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/Public/. If a Labdoo laptop was installed using Labdoo images for cloning the English content is pre-installed.
For an easy download we recommend rsync http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rsync. Rsync is available for a lot of operating systems, e.g. Windows, Apple or Ubuntu: http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/rsync
Or even easier, use our installation script for content http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/images/installskripts/installscript-content.sh.
If you added own content to the folder /home/labdoo/Public and if you want to make sure that all users of the group labdoo (user student as well) gets access please use this script: http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/images/installskripts/set-rights-folder-files-Public-correct.sh.
Wikipedia for schools (wikidoo)
For schools speaking English Labdoo.org recommends "Wikipedia for schools', following the UK National Curriculum : http://www.sos-schools.org/wikipedia-for-schools or http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/Public/wikidoo/, called wikidoo.
Wikidoo will be used, if schools have none or a very slow internet access. This themes were selected and filtered for children. Labdoo calls the wiki "wikidoo".
Wikidoo comes with about 6,000 themes, 26 mio. words and 50,000 pictures (released 10/2013). To start click on file:///home/labdoo/Public/wikidoo/index.htm
Xowa – Wikis
If wikis (lexicon) are needed in other languages than English Labdoo.org recommends Xowa, a tool to import and export more than 800 offline wikis in various languages: http://xowa.sourceforge.net/image_dbs.html. There are more than 800 Xowa-Wikis.
Multimedia English course http://www.englishbanana.com/
A free offline English course is also kept in the folder /Public: file:///home/labdoo/Public/eBooks/English%20Language%20Training%20Version%203.0/index.html. Download from here http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/Public/eBooks/English%20Language%20Training%20Version%203.0/
OER – Open Educational Resources
Labdoo helper collect OER – Open Educational Resources, copy-left, free educational content in various languages. Who wants to contribute is welcome. You can send-in OER or as native speaker search for content in “your” language.
The collected OER can be found here (/English should be pre-installed) http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/Public/eBooks/eBooks%20Collection/ (the content of the folder /english is pre-installed, if using images or installation script for content)
Lubuntu / LXDE manuals, Labdoo Wikis
In the folder /home/labdoo/Public/wikis you will find these wikis, which will be updated every 3 months (beginning of a quarter):
- help.ubuntu.com - wiki.lxde.org - wiki.labdoo.org
Maybe you are right now reading our wiki offline on your laptop? ;)
Free VIP access to http://www.Free-eBooks.net
Labdoo Edoovillages get a free VIP access to the website http://www.Free-eBooks.net. This portal offers one of the largest pool of free e-Books in English, Spanish or Portuguese language.
Please create a free basic user (login) at www.Free-eBooks.net. Using this free basic account you have only limited access, being able to download a few e-books per week.
To get an unlimited VIP access please send an English e-mail to Nic nic@free-ebooks.net, tell him your login (user) and ask him to change the account into a VIP account. Please refer to the agreement between Free-eBooks.net and Labdoo.org. We are grateful for the support and the great offer of Free-eBooks.net.
